quest.name: Brutal Strength
journal: Axemaster Wyrnzoen has a new task for you to undertake.

A formidable creature threatening the safety of western La Noscean inhabitants is to be the next challenge to fall to your axe. Make your way to Aleport, and speak with Wyrnzoen's acquaintance Reynfred to learn more of this prowling menace.
You are to find a likely spot northwest of Aleport in which to do battle. Whistle to lure out Patripatan, then slay the dangerous creature.
You have slain Patripatan. Return to the Marauders' Guild and report to Axemaster Wyrnzoen.

Pleased with the successful completion of your task, Wyrnzoen bids you attempt another traditional marauder training exercise. Speak with Skapfghim on the bank of the Agelyss River in middle La Noscea, and try your hand at this new trial.
Skapfghim draws your attention to a great rock on the bank of the Agelyss River. Destroy the unmovable boulder using a Heavy Swing.
You have successfully shattered the boulder. Report to Skapfghim on the bank of the Agelyss River.
Skapfghim seems satisfied with your boulder-breaking axe swing. Return to the Marauders' Guild and report to Axemaster Wyrnzoen.

In recognition of your feat of strength, Wyrnzoen teaches you a technique that allows you to strike enemies from a distance. Return to your training, and explore the tactical possibilities afforded you by this new ability.

※The next marauder quest will be available from Wyrnzoen upon reaching level 20.
objectives: Whistle to draw out Patripatan, then slay him.
Report to Axemaster Wyrnzoen at the Marauders' Guild.
Speak with Skapfghim in middle La Noscea.
Use Heavy Swing to destroy the unmovable boulder.
Report to Axemaster Wyrnzoen at the Marauders' Guild.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: I see you have been diligent in your training. You need not tell me in words─it shows in your bearing; in your unwavering gaze.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: It is time for you to once more lift your axe in service to the guild. There have been reports of a sizable creature roaming the outskirts of Aleport in western La Noscea.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: This monster is no Kujata, but the threat it presents to the locals is nonetheless sufficient to warrant our attention. It should also prove a worthy foe to test your burgeoning prowess.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: How to find this beast? Well, I am fortunate enough to count among my acquaintances a veteran hunter and archer by the name of Reynfred.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: He took up residence in Aleport some years ago, and will gladly aid you in this task. With Reynfred's assistance, you are to track down this prowling danger and provide it swift and bloody passage to the afterlife. May your axe swing true.

dialogue.name: REYNFRED
dialogue.text: One o' Wyrnzoen's girlsboys, are ye? Why, I've known that sprat since he was knee-high to a─ Well, he was always kind of a big fella, was Wyrnzoen. An' now they call him “Axemaster,” eh? Not a subtle lot, you marauders.

dialogue.name: REYNFRED
dialogue.text: So, I s'pose yer here to hunt down our “local trouble”? What ye need do, then, is take yerself northwest up towards Camp Skull Valley, and give a good whistle.

dialogue.name: REYNFRED
dialogue.text: The mean bugger yer after─his name's “Patripatan,” by the by─will come runnin' across the weeded plains. He'll think yer trespassin' on his territory, see, so ye better have that cleaver o' yers ready. Oschon's blessin's be upon ye.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: I have been in contact with Reynfred, and he had naught but praise for you, Forename. Your representation of the guild has been exemplary.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: There is one more task I would have you complete this day─a task that will demonstrate for you just how strong you have become.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Report to Skapfghim where he waits on the bank of the Agelyss River, and he shall help you unveil the untapped power of your axe.

dialogue.name: SKAPFGHIM
dialogue.text: Aye, lasslad, I know why you're here. And after seeing this big ol' boulder, I'd wager you know why you're here, too.

dialogue.name: SKAPFGHIM
dialogue.text: Now, my rock's a bit more of a challenge than those pebbles Rhotgeim had you training on─to crack this beauty will require a relatively heavy swing. Impossible, you say? Hah, Wyrnzoen wouldn't send you out here if he didn't think you capable.

dialogue.name: SKAPFGHIM
dialogue.text: Go on, then, lasslad. You won't shatter the damn thing just by staring at it!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Destroy the unmovable boulder with your Heavy Swing ability.

dialogue.name: SKAPFGHIM
dialogue.text: Hah, would you look at that! And on your first attempt, too. Well, I guess it's back to the axemaster for you.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: I knew you would return before long─the deafening crack of shattering boulder reached me even here.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: This feat of strength deserves recognition, and you shall have it in the form of a new technique. Adopted and perfected by our guild forebears, the Tomahawk throw was first devised by pirates as an opening attack on closing enemy vessels.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Though we primarily focus on close-quarter combat, you will no doubt find that having a powerful ranged strike at your disposal greatly expands your tactical versatility.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: ...I sense that the impending confrontation with Kujata weighs heavily on your mind, Forename. But hurried swings lead to glancing blows. There is no swift road to attaining the peak of mastery you seek─only a steady, measured ascent.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!
